item.title: Using SSH to Connect to a Remote Server
item.description: Generate SSH Keys Generate SSH Keys of RSA type and 4096 bytes in size. 1 ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 You can then copy the contents of id_rsa.pub and share them as needed for verification. You can use the following commands as well in the process of copying. 1 2 3 ls ~/.ssh ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_rsa cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub | xclip -sel clip Connecting to a Remote Server through SSH Install an OpenSSH Client Check if the client is installed by running ssh on the terminal. If the OpenSSH client is not installed, you can install it using the line 1 sudo apt-get install openssh-client Install an OpenSSH Server Check if OpenSSH Server is installed by running ssh localhost. item.description: Notes for Self Use hugo server -D to open a local server which renderes drafts. By default, hugo organizes posts by date. If you want to override that provide the weight: <int> on the front-matter. The smaller the <int the higher the article in the list. I have provided the value 2 for this article.
